subject: Re: [junit] a test framework to codify levelizaton?
msgSnippet: ... A compiler doesn t know that I have a runtime dependency that is not also a compile-time dependency. Example: method invocation via reflection. -- J. B.
messageBody:
Timothy Wall wrote:

> I am
> intimately familiar with the code, but I still don't keep *everything*
> in my head and when it comes to tracking complex interdependencies, the
> computer does (or should do) it much better than I can. That's why
> we've got compilers, yes?

A compiler doesn't know that I have a runtime dependency that is not
also a compile-time dependency. Example: method invocation via reflection.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
